name: NPR
text:
RT @nprpolitics: #BREAKING: In remarks from the White House, President Trump again falsely claimed victory in the 2020 election. He has not won. Votes continue to be counted.

Trump also made a series of baseless, false claims about allegations of voter fraud.#BREAKING: In remarks from the White House, President Trump again falsely claimed victory in the 2020 election. He… https://t.co/kIZNU0omdr

name: NPR
text:
Pennsylvania Secretary of State Kathy Boockvar said although election workers have counted hundreds of thousands of ballots on Thursday, there’s still several hundred thousand votes remaining to be counted.
https://t.co/6adFt8gEDG

name: NPR
text:
Fox was the first to project that Joe Biden would win Arizona. 

But the Trump campaign is now demanding that the network — whose audience the president considers a key part of his base — reverse its assessment of the state.
https://t.co/XAxQGemX6s

name: NPR
text:
BREAKING: No winner has been declared, but Trump again falsely claimed victory. That's wrong.

Trump also baselessly, recklessly claimed the election is being "stolen" and "rigged." He's losing his lead in some states because the vote is being counted.
https://t.co/EnGPfUmRRt

name: NPR
text:
Facebook removed a group filled with baseless claims about voter fraud and calls for protests over vote-counting — citing "worrying calls for violence" from some members.

The group had gained more than 360,000 members since it was created Wednesday.
https://t.co/gk1Z4sZKCx
